channel.title: Strings :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: We saw before that there is no string type in C. This is true – but you can simulate a string by using an array of characters that is terminated with a special end-of-string character, ‘\0’. String Variables A string literal can be declared as follows: char str[] = "Hello"; After this line, str references the following characters in memory: 0 1 2 3 4 5 H e l l o \0 We could have created the same string like this:
